result.execSummary:
The defendant Shairnee A. Carson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

12-03-2015/ Judge William Brash
Restitution hearing: The (3rd) victim has not provided information.
Restitution set at 0.


$165.00 to Jamie S.,  $300.00  to Michael T. and an amount to be determined for Tara P.  Joint and several wit any other coactors convicted of this offense.

Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  
AS TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count seven, consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 190 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.
Vocational assessment. Participate in any programs recommended.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Jamie S., Michael T., Tara P., coactors Darius Kinney, Darrin Kinney, Harvey Kinney, Tristain Louis-Saffold, Justina Nunely.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court prior to case being called.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin prior to case being called.  State indicated that victim has not provided information.  Court sets restitution at $0.

cDefendant Shairnee A. Carson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 66 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 7, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 190 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the 15 months of these sentences
-Restitution set at $165.00 payable to Jamie S., $300.00 to Michael T., and an amount to be determined for Tara P., joint and several with any other co-actors convicted of this offense, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid before any Court costs, fees and assessments
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-No contact with Jamie S., Michael T., Tara P., co-actors Darius Kinney, Darrin Kinney, Harvey Kinney, Tristain Louis-Saffold, Justina Nunely
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 66 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 190 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the 15 months of these sentences
-Restitution set at $165.00 payable to 
Jamie S., $#00.00 to Michael T., and an amount to be determined for Tara P., joint and several with any other co-actors convicted of this offense, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid before any Court costs, fees and assessments
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-No contact with Jamie S., Michael T., Tara P., co-actors Darius Kinney, Darrin Kinney, Harvey Kinney, Tristain Louis-Saffold, Justina Nunely

-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored

Court sets matter for a Restitution Hearing

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Shairnee A. Carson not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Co-defendant's sentencing is currently scheduled for October 21, 2015.  Parties request an adjournment for after co-defendant's sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Continuation of plea hearing conducted.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1 and 4 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant submits a Guilty Plea Questionnaire.   Court conducts colloquy  with defendant regarding the submission of his guilty plea.  Court is unable to accept defendants guilty plea.  Counsel requests additional time to go over the facts with the defendant.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, Defendant Shairnee A. Carson not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Shairnee A. Carson not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin. Defense just received an offer today and needs more time to discuss the case. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Virginia m Stuller for Glen Kulkoski in court, defendant Shairnee A. Carson not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion for modification of bail heard and denied.

Attorney Virginia m Stuller in court for Attorney Glen Kulkoski, defendant Shairnee A. Carson not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion for modification of bail filed.  Court unable to hear this bail motion today.  Matter reset for Bail Motion.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
For Modification of Bail received and filed.

Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.

Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Shairnee A. Carson in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   No Information is filed by the State.  Arraignment scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MICHAEL T., JAMIE S., JOE M. & MALLET FOODS, TARA ANN P., FRANK L., BURNETTA J., TOMESENA L., DIANA M., MYRA D. AND JERALD D.
CO-ACTORS:  DARRIN KINNEY, DARIUS KINNEY, HARVEY KINNEY, TRISTAIN LOUIS-SAFFOLD AND JUSTINE NUNELY; ALSO KEEP SEPARATE WHILE IN CUSTODY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shairnee A. Carlson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Shairnee A. Carlson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS DNA TO BE COLLECTED.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
